text: I mean, my mother didn't think -- couldn't think -- that -- that it was my good fortune -- that, in short, that she had never loved him.

passages.fragment: I mean , my mother didn't think -- could n't think -- that -- that it was
passages.full_quote: <used>I mean, my mother didn't think -- couldn't think -- that -- that it was</used>

passages.fragment: -- that it was my good fortune -- that , in short ,
passages.full_quote: that I was _not_ blinded -- <used>that it was my good fortune -- that, in short, I</used> was somehow or other safe from him.

passages.fragment: , in short , that she had never
passages.full_quote: She saw, that in persuading herself, in fancying, in acting to the contrary, she had been entirely under a delusion, totally ignorant of her own heart -- and, <used>in short, that she had never</used> really cared for Frank Churchill at all

passages.fragment: that she had never loved him
passages.full_quote: He had found her agitated and low. -- Frank Churchill was a villain. -- He heard her declare <used>that she had never loved him</used>
